00009 ORTrigger32ClockTreeWriter::ORTrigger32ClockTreeWriter(string treeName) :
00010 ORVTreeWriter(new ORTrigger32ClockDecoder, treeName)
00011 {
00012   fTrigger32ClockDecoder = dynamic_cast<ORTrigger32ClockDecoder*>(fDataDecoder); // just renaming
00013   fTriggerBitsFilter = kBothTriggers;
00014   fTriggerBits = 0;
00015   fT_s = 0.0;
00016 }
00017 
00018 ORTrigger32ClockTreeWriter::~ORTrigger32ClockTreeWriter()
00019 {
00020   delete fTrigger32ClockDecoder;
00021 }

00023 ORDataProcessor::EReturnCode ORTrigger32ClockTreeWriter::InitializeBranches()
00024 {
00025   fTree->Branch("trigBits", &fTriggerBits, "trigBits/i");
00026   fTree->Branch("t_s", &fT_s, "t/D");
00027   return kSuccess;
00028 }
00029 
00030 ORDataProcessor::EReturnCode ORTrigger32ClockTreeWriter::ProcessMyDataRecord(UInt_t* record)
00031 {
00032   if(!(fTrigger32ClockDecoder->EventTriggerBitsOf(record) & fTriggerBitsFilter)) {
00033     // don't write to tree if we are filtering out the trigger records of
00034     // one or the other trigger
00035     return kFailure;
00036   }
00037   fTriggerBits = fTrigger32ClockDecoder->EventTriggerBitsOf(record);
00038   fT_s = fTrigger32ClockDecoder->GetMacTime_s(record);
00039 
00040   // check severity to improve speed
00041   if(ORLogger::GetSeverity() >= ORLogger::kDebug) { 
00042     ORLog(kDebug) << "ProcessMyDataRecord(): bits = " << fTriggerBits << ", t = " << fT_s << endl;
00043   }
00044 
00045   return kSuccess;
00046 }
